item.title: at war: taliban cuts cellphone service
item.description: mobile phone networks throughout helmand province have been silenced for nearly a week under orders from the taliban, according to a cellphone carrier.

item.description: a devastating drought tightened its grip on texas over the last week with more than half the state now suffering the most extreme level of drought measured by climatologists.

item.description: rapper nate dogg will be remembered this weekend in several southern california events, and everyone is invited.

item.description: justice department's historic antitrust settlement with software giant microsoft is passing with little fanfare.

item.title: steve wozniak says would consider return to apple
item.description: steve wozniak would consider returning to an active role at apple, the company he co-founded, and believes the consumer electronics giant could afford to be more open than it is, he told reuters.

item.description: sunday dinner and shared sacrifice add to the appeal of cbs' hit police procedural.

item.title: most u.s. voters say "no" to palin or trump in 2012
item.description: nearly 60 percent of americans would never support a republican presidential bid by former alaska governor sarah palin or real estate mogul and reality tv star donald trump, according to a new poll wednesday.
